name: Cox and Kings Global Services
goal:
- CKGS aims to provide its services to European missions globally.
- We provide Outsourcing services of non decision making services that are only administrative in nature and assist European diplomatic missions by supporting them with the required infrastructure.
- We continue to provide our existing government clients with dynamic technical solutions that contain security of data and safe document handling as its core.
- To provide European missions with services that focus on key fundamentals of administrative work management.
- We aim to develop our engagement at the European commission to understand the development in visa policies that require our services to evolve accordingly.
interests: Communication, Competition, Development, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Home Affairs
euInitiatives:
We follow the European commission Visa code handbook COMMISSION IMPLEMENTING DECISION C(2014) 2727
of 29.4.2014

The Visa code handbook acts as a SOP ( standard operating practices) for our team training's, and is regularly visited by our Operation managers as a reference manual.

Additional information:

CKGS operates Visa application centres for Schengen missions on exclusive contracts acquired through a registered tendering process. The Missions outsource their administrative support services in the Visa application cycle to CKGS to focus their efforts on their core tasks. Outsourcing of such services also takes away the security, and general manpower constraints that a mission would need to take on, inorder to process Tourist or business Visa applications for persons wishing to travel to the European country.

Updates and future developments on the Visa code directly impact the nature of our operational processes. The introduction to the European commission will assist us in preparing for any changes that are planned, that might impact the operational processes in place at our Visa Application centres.
